Thank you for contacting Quia. It sounds like your lab may not have enough bandwidth for all of your students to take the exam at the same time. We recommend that for each student that is taking the test, your connection has 80kbps of bandwidth. If you have 25 students, you would want to have 2mbps of bandwidth. Keep in mind that if there are multiple classes at your school taking it at the same time, the amount of bandwidth that your school will grow proportionately. You can go to www.speakeasy.net/speedtest to test your download bandwidth. Choose "San Francisco, CA" as the location you want to test your speed for to get an accurate idea of your speeds.

You may also contact us via phone at 877-282-4400, x5 for technical support.

Let us know if you have any questions and we will be happy to assist you.
closing: Sincerely,</br>NAME</br>Quia Support</br>nse@quia.com
name: Bandwidth

body:
Thank you for contacting Quia. Each student may only take the National Japanese Exam once. Students will be automatically barred from taking the exam multiple times. However, if something goes wrong the first time a student takes the test -- for example, if the power goes out, the Internet connection fails, or the student accidentally hits the "Submit" button before completing the test -- you can add attempts for individual students.

To add an attempt for a student, follow these steps:

1. Log into your instructor Quia account.
2. Click the "Quizzes" link in the upper left corner.
3. Click "Add attempts" next to the exam for which you want to allow an extra attempt (achievement or proficiency).
4. Change the number of attempts to 2 using the drop-down menu labeled "Attempts" next to the student's name.
5. When you are finished, click "Done".

The student will now be able to log in and attempt the exam a second time using the same username and password.

If you have any questions, please let us know.
closing: Sincerely,</br>NAME</br>Quia Support</br>nje@quia.com
name: Adding an additional attempt

greeting: Thank you for contacting Quia. I am happy to help!
body:
If your students' quizzes are appearing as "In Progress" then that means that they did not submit or save their work. When they do submit their work, they will always see a confirmation page that states "Thank you. Your quiz has been submitted". If they save their work to complete later instead, they must make sure to click “Done” immediately after clicking "Save for later", or else their attempt will not be saved. If students did not submit their work or save it to complete later, there is no way to recover it.

However, if your quiz's presentation style was set to display "one question at a time", students would have been required to submit each answer before proceeding to the next question. This would save each question they answered to our servers. In this case you will be able to recover their answers to the questions they did submit.

To check if your students' work was partially submitted to Quia and grade their quizzes, you must first wait until their grades are no longer shown as "In progress" and instead have switched to "Abandoned", which takes approximately 6 hours. After the quizzes appear as "Abandoned" in your grading workbench, you can follow these steps to manually grade your students' attempts:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and enter your username and password.
2. Click "Quizzes" in your left menu.
3. Click "Grade" next to your quiz.
4. Scroll down to the "Student Summary" section.
5. Locate one of your student's abandoned quiz attempts.
6. Click the pencil icon to the left of their name.
7. Confirm that you would like to submit your student’s incomplete quiz attempt.
8. Click "Submit" at the bottom of the page.

Your student's incomplete quiz attempt can now be graded and submitted as if the student had submitted his or her work normally.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist you.
name: "In Progress" Quia Results

body:
I understand you have a question about ads appearing when practicing on IXL. IXL does not include any banners or advertisements at all. Any ads you see are caused by adware, a form of software that can infect your computer. When these types of programs infect your computer, they will display banners and advertisements on any website at any time, including IXL. You can avoid ads by signing in to your account on any uninfected computer, but I strongly recommend that you download an adware removal program so that you can eliminate this software from your system.

There are many varieties of adware removal software available online. While we do not officially recommend any, some of our members have had success with LavaSoft Ad-Aware. Ad-Aware is an adware and malware removal program that can be downloaded to your computer for free here:

www.LavaSoft.com

Once you download the program and run it on your computer, you should not see any more ads or banners while practicing on IXL.
greeting: none
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist.
name: Remove adware

I'm happy to help you hide grade levels in IXL to meet the needs of your students. To hide grade levels, please follow these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in to your account.
2) Click the arrow next to your name in the top-right corner to open your account menu, then select Profile & settings.
3) In the Profiles and settings window, scroll down to the Setting section and select the Hide grade levels check box. The setting change will apply to everyone on your account.
4) Click Submit.
5) Direct your students to sign in at http://www.ixl.com/signin. Otherwise, they will see the actual grade levels on the IXL home page.

Once your students sign in at http://www.ixl.com/signin, the grade levels will be hidden. When the grade levels are hidden pre-K becomes "Level A", kindergarten becomes "Level B", etc.

This makes it easy to upload questions into Quia and to share quizzes with other colleagues that use Quia as well, and we have a lot of wonderful reports that you can use as tracking tools.

While we cannot merge the data from two accounts, we can swap the data so that your student’s progress from the older school account will now be transferred to the newer school account the student will use from now on. However, this will mean that any existing progress in the older account will be cleared.

To get started transferring STUDENTNAME’s practice over to the new account, I will first need e-mail permission from OLDSCHOOLNAME and the username from that account. Please ask the principal at that school to write to help@ixl.com granting permission to transfer the student’s data. To ensure the quickest reply, please have them include the case number CASENUMBER in their e-mail.

Once I have received the e-mail giving me permission to move the information over to the student’s new account, I will be able to transfer the data.

greeting: Thank you for contacting Quia.
body:
If you log in to your account and click "Quizzes" from the left-side menu, you can assign quizzes and set distribution options by clicking the "Assign" link for the appropriate quiz.

From here you will be able to define and set the following parameters for your quiz:

Classes - You can make your quiz available to anyone or limit it to certain classes by selecting the check boxes for the appropriate class(es). To limit it to one or more classes, you'll first need to set up class rosters if you haven't done this already.

Presentation style - Choose to show questions all at once or one at a time.

Anonymity - Require student names to access the quiz, make names optional, or do not ask for names.

Feedback - Choose how much feedback students see when they submit their responses, including whether or not they see the answers.

Attempts permitted - You can set a limit on the number of times a student can take the quiz, and which score to include in the gradebook.

Time limit - Limit the amount of time students have to complete the quiz. Students will see a countdown timer while they are taking the quiz.

Allow access - Set a date and time range that your quiz will be available to students.

Secret word - Set a secret word or password that students must enter in order to take your quiz.

Security - Enable settings that prevent students from copying questions or answers to other accounts or into other applications.

Below the Global settings section, you can set distribution options per class or even for particular students, as needed. When you are finished setting distribution options, click "Done" at the bottom of the page.

We have an excellent tutorial at http://www.quia.com/tutorials/quiz_options that explains quiz distribution settings and the control they offer in greater detail.
closing: If you have any questions about the distribution options available for Quia quizzes or anything else in Quia, please let me know and I will be happy to assist you!
name: Quiz Assigning Options

greeting: Thank you for contacting Quia for assistance with your NGE registration. You can make changes to your NGE registration by following these steps:
body:
1. Go to http://www.aatg.org/?page=NGE.
2. Select "Member" or "Non-Member" registration.
3. Enter the same e-mail address you used to initially register for the NGE.
4. Select the option to update an existing registration.
5. Enter the NGE registration confirmation number that appears at the top of your e-mail confirmation and click "Next."

You will see your NGE registration form with your previous information filled-in. Make any necessary changes here.

5. When you are finished making changes, click "Submit" at the bottom of the page.
6. Review the confirmation page and click "Submit" again to complete your registration.

You can print out the invoice page for your records, and an updated confirmation message will be sent to you via e-mail.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist you.
name: Updating NGE Registration

Thank you for contacting Quia. It sounds like your lab may not have enough bandwidth for all of your students to take the exam at the same time. We recommend that for each student that is taking the test, your connection has 80kbps of bandwidth. If you have 25 students, you would want to have 2mbps of bandwidth. Keep in mind that if there are multiple classes at your school taking the exam at the same time, the amount of bandwidth that your school will grow proportionately. You can go to www.speakeasy.net/speedtest to test your download bandwidth. Choose "San Francisco, CA" as the location you connect to to get an accurate idea of your speeds.

You are also welcome to contact me via phone at 877-282-4400, x5 for technical support.

Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist you.

greeting: Thank you for contacting Quia.
body:
When you log into your Quia account, the students you registered for the exam appear on your class roster.

If you would like to register additional students to take the exam, please follow these steps:

1. Log in to http://www.quia.com/web using your NIE username and password.
2. Use the "Class" menu to go to the roster for the appropriate level exam.
3. Type the students' first and last names into the blank rows of the roster. (If you run out of space, click "Add more rows..." to add additional rows at the bottom.)
4. When you have added all the students, click "Save changes".

A username and password will be generated for each new student. To view the student's account information, click on the "lock icon" to the right of the new student added and here is where you'll see the student's login "username" and "password." Please provide this to your student.

Please note that adding new student/s may require that you also pay an additional fee per new student registered. We suggest you contact AATI to ask about additional billing information.

If you have any questions, please let us know.
closing: Sincerely,</br>NAME</br>Quia Support</br>nie@quia.com
name: Adding a student

body:
I am happy to help with your question about rewards.

There are a few different types of rewards that can be earned on IXL. Medals and certificates are awarded periodically as children practice. Awards, though, are acquired after specific challenges are met. These challenges vary, with some requiring children to master a certain number of skills in a category, or to practice a certain number of questions. Completing a challenge will allow children to reveal that prize on the awards board.

To see which challenges are available to earn a math award, go to Learning in your account and click Awards. Select Math awards beneath the tabs, and hover your cursor over any of the squares marked with a question mark. You will then see the challenge required to unlock that prize. Some challenges are not available to be unlocked until an earlier challenge has been completed. For example, "Complete 200 questions" is not available until after the award for "Complete 100 questions" has been earned.
greeting: none
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be glad to assist.
name: Why didn't I win an award? (Math)

greeting: Thank you for contacting Quia. I am happy to help!
body:
To archive your quiz results and reset the hit counter, you can follow these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2. Click "Quizzes" in the left menu.
3. Check the boxes to the right of each quiz you want to archive.
4. Click the "Other actions..." drop down menu and select "Archive results and reset count."

For any quiz that has results that have been archived, only new submissions for that quiz will be available to grade.

To view these results later, scroll past the list of quizzes and view the archived results in the "Archived Quiz Results" folder. Click the folder to open it and then click the "View" link to view the archived results.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist you.
name: Archiving Quiz Results

Thank you for contacting Quia. You can substitute a student, and as long as the number of students that take the exam is the same as the number you registered for, you will not be charged an additional fee.

If you need to substitute a student, simply add him or her to the roster. A new username and password will be generated for the student. Be sure that the student uses the new username when taking the exam. As long as the original student does not take the exam, you will not be charged an additional fee.

To substitute a student, please follow these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web
2. Log into your instructor account
3. Navigate to the appropriate class roster using the Class drop-down menu in the upper left
4. Type the student's first and last names into a blank row of the roster
5. When you have added the student, click "Save changes"
A username and password will be generated for the new student. Click the lock icon next to the username to view the password.
Simply ignore the entry for the original student.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know.
name: Substituting Students

When you enter advanced HTML tags on Quia or create a Text/HTML field in a quiz, any hard returns (pressing your "Enter" key) or other white space (tabbing or using the space bar) is ignored, since it may interfere with your formatting.

To include the line breaks in your text, you can enter a br tag (which can be typed as:
or <br>) where you want the line break to appear. Using more than one in a row will insert extra spaces between lines.

We've recently released Spanish Level 1, beginner Spanish, which includes:

  • Practice geared toward high school and middle school students. Learners of all ages can also benefit!
  • Grammar, vocabulary, reading, and listening skills with colorful illustrations and photos that bring the language and its speakers to life.
  • Professionally recorded audio highlights with 15 different Spanish accents that expose students to the diversity of the language and prepare them for interactions with native speakers.

We do not have any current plans to extend our coverage to other levels.

If you'd like to try Spanish, or any of our subjects, you can practice 10 questions for free each day. To get started, just click the name of the subject you'd like to practice at the top of the page within the Learning section.

Likewise, you should assume whatever materials of your own you post online can be viewed and "borrowed" by anyone in the world (unless it's part of a Quia quiz to which you have restricted access).

body:
To export quiz results from your Quia Web account, follow these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2. Click "Quizzes" in the left menu.
3. Locate the appropriate quiz and click the upward-pointing arrow icon for it.
4. Select the appropriate options and click "Export".

Quia will prompt you to save a copy of students' quiz results to your computer. The file will be in .CSV (comma-separated value) format. This format can be imported into Microsoft Excel and into most learning management systems or gradebook programs.

I also want to let you know that Quia provides detailed reports with intuitive graphical representations of your students' quiz results. You can print these reports in addition to exporting the raw data.

For more information on the types of reports Quia offers, you can find a tutorial here:

http://www.quia.com/tutorials/quiz_reports helpful
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist you!
name: Exporting Quiz Results

body:
Thank you for contacting Quia. Each student may only take the National Italian Exam once. Students will be automatically barred from taking the exam multiple times. However, if something goes wrong the first time a student takes the test -- for example, if the power goes out, the Internet connection fails, or the student accidentally hits the "Submit" button before completing the test -- you can add attempts for individual students.

To add an attempt for a student, follow these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web
2. Log into your instructor Quia account.
3. Click the "Quizzes" link in the upper left corner.
4. Click the folder next to the student's exam level.
5. Click "Add attempts" next to the exam for which you want to allow an extra attempt (achievement or proficiency).
6. Change the number of attempts to 2 using the drop-down menu labeled "Attempts" next to the student's name.
7. When you are finished, click "Done".

The student will now be able to log in and attempt the exam a second time using the same username and password.

If you have any questions, please let us know.
closing: Sincerely,</br>NAME</br>Quia Support</br>nie@quia.com
name: Adding an additional attempt

You may also contact us via phone at 877-282-4400, x5 for technical support.

Let us know if you have any questions and we will be happy to assist you.
closing: Sincerely,</br>NAME</br>Quia Support</br>nie@quia.com
name: Bandwidth

Thank you for contacting Quia. You can substitute a student, and as long as the number of students that take the exam is the same as the number you registered for, you will not be charged an additional fee.

If you need to substitute a student, simply add him or her to the roster for the appropriate level and ignore the entry for the original student. A new username and password will be generated for the student. Be sure that the student uses the new username when taking the exam. As long as the original student does not take the exam, you will not be charged an additional fee.

To substitute a student, please follow these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web
2. Log into your instructor account
3. Navigate to the appropriate class roster using the Class drop-down menu in the upper left
4. Type the student's first and last names into a blank row of the roster
5. When you have added the student, click "Save changes"
A username and password will be generated for the new student. Click the lock icon next to the username to view the password.
Simply ignore the entry for the original student.

If you have any questions, please let me know.

Thank you for contacting Quia. Each student may only take the National German Exam once. Students will be automatically barred from taking the exam multiple times. However, if something goes wrong the first time a student takes the test -- for example, if the power goes out, the Internet connection fails, or the student accidentally hits the "Submit" button before completing the test -- you can add attempts for individual students.

To add an attempt for a student, follow these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web
2. Log into your instructor Quia account.
3. Click the "Quizzes" link in the upper left corner.
4. Click the folder next to the student's exam level.
5. Click "Add attempts" next to the exam for which you want to allow an extra attempt.
6. Change the number of attempts to 2 using the drop-down menu labeled "Attempts" next to the student's name.
7. When you are finished, click "Done".

The student will now be able to log in and attempt the exam a second time using the same username and password.
closing: If you have any questions, please let us know.

body:
To add events to your calendar in Quia, you can follow these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2. Click "Calendar" in left menu.
3. In the new window that opens, click the "Add Event" link located near the top-right corner.
4. Enter all the event details, including the date, time, and which classes it should apply to, then click "Done".
5. Repeat steps 3-4 until you've added all events to your calendar, then close the calendar window.

To make your calendar accessible to your students from their class Web page, follow these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2. Click "Classes" in the left menu.
3. Locate the class that you want to give access to your calendar and click its "Edit" link.
4. In the "Additional options" section, select the check box for the option that allows you to include a calendar for the class.
5. Click "Save changes".
6. Repeat steps 3-5 for any other classes on whose pages you'd like to include a calendar link.

To learn more about creating classes and linking your calendar to class Web pages, you can view our helpful tutorial at http://www.quia.com/tutorials/class_edit
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist you.
name: Adding a calendar/events

To clear your gradebook and begin the new school year, let your old class expire and create a brand new class. You can copy over the class page, assignments, etc., to this new class to save yourself some time. To do so, please follow these steps:

1) Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2) Click "Classes" in the left menu.
3) Click the "Create a new class" button.
4) Fill out the form (make sure to enter an end date) and click "Submit".
5) Click "Classes" in the left menu.
6) Locate your old class and click the "Edit" link.
7) Enter this class' actual end date.
8) Scroll to the bottom of the page and check the box next to the name of the new class that you created in step 4.
9) Click "Save changes".

Your old class will expire, but all of its assignments and customizations will be copied over to your newly created class.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist you.

To insert specific questions from your Question Bank into your quiz, follow these steps:

1. Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2. Click "Quizzes" in the left menu.
3. Click the "Advanced" link near the top of the page to switch to the Advanced Quiz Editor.
4. Click "Create a new quiz", or click the "Edit" link for a quiz you want to modify.
5. In "Section 2: Questions" choose "One or more specific questions (from the Question Bank)" from the "Insert" list.
6. In the window that opens, search for the questions you want to add (if the window does not open, you may have a "pop-up blocker" turned on).
7. Select the check boxes for the questions you want to insert into your quiz and click "Add selected questions to quiz" at the bottom of the page.

Quia returns you to your quiz, where you will see that the questions have been added.

For more information on Quia's Advanced quizzes and adding questions from the question bank, we have an excellent tutorial at http://www.quia.com/tutorials/quiz_advanced you might be interested in.

greeting: Thank you for contacting Quia.
body:
You can use HTML to add subscripts and superscripts to Quia activities. To create superscripts, use the "sup" tag.

For example, if you want to enter 4 raised to the power of 2 you type the following:

42
OR
4<sup>2</sup>

To create subscripts, use the "sub" tag.

For example, if you want to enter the chemical formula for water you type the following:

H2O
OR
H<sub>2</sub>O

Quia allows HTML in any activity field that is marked with a blue plus sign. When you use HTML, you must remember to select the "Activate HTML" check box option in the settings step of the activity editor.

For more information on what you can do with HTML tags, you can go to http://www.quia.com/help/activities/HTMLformat.html or you can view our tutorial at http://www.quia.com/tutorials/activity_fancy
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist you.
name: Subscripts/Superscripts

As long as they are required to log in to take your quiz, students can use their own Quia accounts to view the results of all their quiz attempts. To view their quiz results your students can follow these steps:

1) Go to http://www.quia.com/web and log in.
2) If you see a link with the name of your class, click on it. (If you don't see that link, skip this step.)
3) Look for the name of your quiz.
4) Click the black and white icon to the left of your quiz name.

A pop-up window will appear containing a summary of that student's submission for that quiz.

The amount of feedback students receive in that summary depends on the settings selected for the quiz, ranging from "Score only" to "Score, summary, and answers." The level of feedback will need to be set to at least "Score and summary" if you would like students to see the feedback and comments you've left them.
closing: If you would like more information on how to change the feedback for your quiz, or if you have any questions at all, please let me know and I will be happy to assist you.
name: How do students view quiz results?

body:
If Quia is performing slowly on the computers at your school, your school's network security settings may need to be adjusted. Security used to protect your school's network may be mistakenly blocking or altering data coming to and from Quia.

Please have your school's IT professional add quia.com to the list of trusted sites on any firewalls or proxy servers your school uses. Traffic from Quia should be allowed through your security and content filters without restrictions. In addition, no content from Quia should ever be cached by proxy servers at your school. Quia should then return to its usual high performance.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns. If it's more convenient, give me a call at (877)282-4400x5.  Feel free to ask for me by name.  I want to make sure you get the most out of Quia.
name: School Network Trouble

2. SECRET WORDS

Please note that the contents of the e-mails is confidential. No student should be given access to these documents.

If you did not receive both of these emails, first check the SPAM (JUNK) folder for your email. If the missing e-mail is not there, please contact National German Exam support at help@quia.com or (877) 282-4400, press #5.

The SECRET WORDS listed below are required to access the National German Exam. Please PRINT OUT this e-mail prior to exam administration.

2018 Level 2 Listening and Viewing: essen2
2018 Level 2 Reading: trinken2

2018 Level 3 Listening and Viewing: lernen3
2018 Level 3 Reading: schreiben3

2018 Level 4 Listening and Viewing: fahren4
2018 Level 4 Reading: fliegen4

See the National German Exam ADMINISTRATION MANUAL (www.aatg.org/resource/resmgr/nge/NGEAdministrationManual_2018.pdf) for details on how to

body:
Thank you for your interest in IXL!

IXL is a self-paced practice environment designed to fit the needs and learning styles of students at all levels. Our flexible, web-based curriculum allows every child to have a customized experience, building their fluency and mastery in maths and English.

IXL gives you access to all levels, so your child will have the option to go back and review previously studied material or move ahead to new skills at any time. As children practice on IXL, the program adapts to their ability, increasing the level of difficulty as they improve and providing instant feedback and explanations whenever they answer questions incorrectly.

We also offer 10 questions for free in each subject per day so you can see if IXL is a good fit for your family. Once you have created a membership, your child will have unlimited access to practice and you will have access to IXL Analytics, which allows you to monitor how much time your child spends on IXL, the questions they answered, and the skills that have been the most challenging for them.

For more information and to purchase a family membership, visit our Membership Page.
greeting: none
closing: Let me know if you have any other questions. I'm always happy to help!
name: What is IXL? (International)

body:
Thank you for reaching out!

IXL is a fully web-based learning program so we do not have printable worksheets. Instead of requiring you to grade and manage worksheets, we track every child's practice so that you can freely monitor their progress with IXL Analytics.

In addition, IXL is interactive, so as students practice, IXL adapts problems to their ability, increasing the level of difficulty as they improve and providing instant feedback and explanations when students answer questions incorrectly.

We provide a number of motivational printable materials that can enhance your children's experience, including progress charts and customizable certificates. You can access these materials on our Resources page.

body:
IXL is a popular tool with homeschooling families who use IXL to help reinforce the concepts that parents introduce in their lessons. As children practice on IXL, the program adapts to their ability, increases the level of difficulty as they improve, and provides instant feedback whenever they answer questions incorrectly.

Your children will have unlimited access to IXL content from all grades, giving them the option to go back and review previously studied material or move ahead to a new skill. You'll be able to stay up-to-date with their progress using IXL Analytics, our extensive reporting and tracking suite. With customizable settings and easy-to-understand visualizations, there is no simpler way to monitor individual student performance, improvement, and trouble spots.

For more information and to purchase a family membership, visit our Membership page.
greeting: Thank you for reaching out. I'm excited to hear that you're interested in purchasing an IXL family membership!
closing: Let me know if you have any other questions, and I'll be happy to help.
name: Homeschooling - International

body:
Thank you for reaching out!

IXL is a self-paced program designed to meet the needs of a variety of learning styles. Many families that have children with special learning requirements use IXL because it is flexible and allows students to access all grade levels while practicing at their own pace. Your child will have the option to go back and review previously studied material or move ahead to try new skills at any time.

Additionally, IXL provides the option to hide both the grade level and timer if your child is sensitive to these components. You can use the Topics menu as a guide to finding skills to practice rather than searching only by grade level.

To find out how real teachers are using IXL as a supplemental program in their RTI/MTSS and special education classes, visit our blog.

For more information and to purchase a family membership, visit our Membership page.
greeting: none
closing: I am happy to discuss how IXL can best fit your child’s needs. You may call us at (855) 255-8800 from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. ET.
name: Special Needs

body:
Thank you for reaching out!

While we don’t have a one-time placement test, IXL continually adapts to your child's needs. You can easily monitor progress and choose appropriate skills with our IXL features.

These features include:

  • IXL Analytics: IXL Analytics allows you to easily monitor your child's progress and access detailed reports that will provide valuable insight regarding your child's trouble spots and current performance.
  • IXL SmartScore: The IXL SmartScore provides a real-time reflection of your child's fluency with each skill. After answering some questions, the SmartScore will give you an idea of your child's skill level. Earning a SmartScore of 80 indicates proficiency and a SmartScore of 100 indicates mastery.

To get started, we recommend that your child begins practicing in their grade level or on a topic that they are currently learning at home or at school. You also have access to skills from all grade levels, giving you the option to go back and review previously studied material or move ahead to a new skill.
greeting: none
closing: If you have any questions let me know and I will be happy to help.
name: - Placement Test - International

body:
While we don’t have a one-time placement test, IXL continually adapts to your child's needs. You can easily monitor progress and choose appropriate skills with our IXL features.

These features include:

  • IXL Continuous Diagnostic: The IXL Diagnostic, our newest feature for math and language arts, provides complete and up-to-the-minute knowledge about your child's level. It will assess what your child already knows and provide recommendations on what to do next and how to improve.

  • IXL Recommendations: When your child is practicing math or language arts, we provide personalized recommendations that will target trouble spots, encourage your child to challenge themselves, and explore new topics.

  • IXL Analytics: IXL Analytics allows you to easily monitor your child's progress and access detailed reports that will provide valuable insight regarding your child's trouble spots and current performance.

  • IXL SmartScore: The IXL SmartScore provides a real-time reflection of your child's fluency with each skill. A SmartScore of 80 indicates that your child has a solid understanding of the concept.

To get started, we recommend that your child begins practicing in their grade level or on a topic that they are currently learning at home or at school. You also have access to skills from all grade levels, giving you the option to go back and review previously studied material or move ahead to a new skill.

Thank you for reaching out!

IXL is not set up to be shared between different families. Instead, we recommend that families purchase their own membership for the best possible experience on IXL. This gives each family greater control over their account as well as helps to ensure the security of their billing information and the confidentiality of their children's practice.

Each family membership is registered to a single e-mail address and includes one Parent profile only which allows the parent to make changes to the account. This profile will also receive all of the email reports and updates on the account, allowing you to receive direct feedback each week on your child's progress. The parent profile also stores all of the billing information, settings, and detailed Analytics for each child on the membership.

For more information and to purchase a family membership, visit our Membership page.

body:
Thank you for your interest in IXL!

IXL is a self-paced practice environment designed to fit the needs and learning styles of students at all levels. Our flexible, web-based curriculum allows every child to have a customized experience, building their fluency and mastery in math, language arts, science, social studies, and Spanish.

IXL gives you access to all grade levels, so your child will have the option to go back and review previously studied material or move ahead to new skills at any time.

As children practice on IXL, the program adapts to their ability, increasing the level of difficulty as they improve and providing instant feedback and explanations whenever they answer questions incorrectly. Your child will be able to view customized skill recommendations based on their math and language arts practice with IXL Recommendations

If you're not sure where to start in math or language arts, the IXL Continuous Diagnostic will assess what your child already knows and provide direction about what to work on next.

We also offer 10 questions for free in each subject per day so you can see if IXL is a good fit for your family. Once you have created a membership, your child will have unlimited access to practice and you will have access to IXL Analytics, which allows you to monitor how much time your child spends on IXL, the questions they answered, and the skills that have been the most challenging for them.

For more information and to purchase a family membership, visit our Membership Page.

body:
The IXL Continuous Diagnostic is our newest feature, providing complete and up-to-the-minute knowledge about your child's math and language arts level. It will show what your child already knows and offers personalized recommendations on what to do next and how to improve.

To get started, click the Diagnostic tab. After just a few questions you will start to see your child's level and receive recommendations. While the IXL Continuous Diagnostic doesn’t have a designated stopping point, we recommend that students initially aim to diagnose until they reveal complete diagnostic data—for most students, this will be 100-120 questions and will include questions from both math and language arts. Your child can stop and return at any time.

body:
If you're not sure where to begin with your child, we recommend starting their practice at their current grade level and then moving to higher or lower grades as appropriate. IXL allows students to access activities from any grade level at any time. While some families search for specific topics or address specific skills, others follow the skills in the order listed.

To find your child's grade level in math, your child can take our IXL Continuous Diagnostic. While your child answers questions within the Diagnostic arena, it will assess what your child already knows and will show their level within the different math and language arts topics. Then, they can use Recommendations to access a list of skills to practice, curated just for them.

Our IXL Recommendations feature suggests math and language arts skills for students to learn in order to target their trouble spots, challenge themselves, explore new topics, and more.

Once your child has started practicing, you'll be able to review their progress with IXL Analytics, our comprehensive reporting tool.

body:
We do not provide introductory lessons, as IXL is designed as a tool that children can use to practice and develop fluency in topics that they’re learning at school or at home. Although we do not offer tutorials, we do offer detailed explanations after incorrect answers. Our explanations include a step-by-step breakdown of how to answer the question, as well as descriptions of any formulas or concepts related to the question. Additionally, each explanation is specific to the actual question received.

On IXL, the focus is on active learning: students learn by jumping right into solving problems, and as they practice, IXL moves them through a progressive set of questions that adapt to their abilities. This challenges and engages students, while building their confidence and developing their curiosity.

As your children practice on IXL, you'll be able to track their progress to help you decide what skills to work on next. Just click on the Analytics tab at the top of the page and you'll be able to see a thorough analysis of your child's recent practice.
greeting: Thank you for reaching out.

body:
Thank you for reaching out. I'm sorry to hear that you have been frustrated by the SmartScore, and I appreciate that you've reached out to let us know. We value your feedback and I will share your experiences with our design team.

I'd like to share some information and ideas that may help make practicing less frustrating and more fun.

  • No need to rush: Challenge Zone questions can be tough, and it takes several correct answers in a row to reach 100. Check your answers, work carefully, and use the knowledge you've gained from earlier questions in the skill.
  • Use IXL's explanations: The Challenge Zone is about solidifying your skills, so if you miss a question, read the explanation to get the key steps and strategies you need.
  • Take a break and come back: If you are getting frustrated, try practicing a different skill for a while, then come back to that first skill and try again later.
  • Remember that 100 is always within reach: SmartScore is a measure of progress, so no matter how many questions you miss along the way, you always have the chance to reach mastery in a skill on IXL.

I hope you find some of these suggestions helpful. You can also visit our SmartScore guide if you would like to learn more about how the SmartScore works.
greeting: none
closing: Feel free to reach out with any other questions, and I will be happy to help.
name: SmartScore (child)

body:
Thank you for reaching out. I'm sorry to hear that you and your child have been frustrated by the SmartScore, and I appreciate that you've reached out to let us know. We value your feedback and I will share your experiences with our design team.

I'd like to share some information and suggestions that may help alleviate some of the frustration you and your child are experiencing.
  • 80 is a great place to start: When your child first begins a new skill, setting a SmartScore goal of 80 is a great place to start. A SmartScore of 80 indicates that your child has a solid understanding of the concept. Later in the month, challenge your child to reach 90, or to master the skill for extra credit.
  • Set goals: Setting goals of answering a certain number of questions a day or practicing for a certain amount of time is another great strategy. Practicing for even just 10 minutes a day is proven to increase fluency and confidence.
  • No need to rush: Challenge Zone questions can be tough, and it takes several correct answers in a row to reach 100. Check your answers, work carefully, and use the knowledge you’ve gained from earlier questions in the skill.
  • Use IXL’s explanations: The Challenge Zone is about solidifying your skills, so if you miss a question, read the explanation to get the key steps and strategies you need.
  • Take a break and come back: If you are getting frustrated, try practicing a different skill for a while, then come back to that first skill and try again later.
  • Remember that 100 is always within reach: SmartScore is a measure of progress, so no matter how many questions you miss along the way, you always have the chance to reach mastery in a skill on IXL.

I hope you and your child find some of these suggestions helpful. You can also visit our SmartScore guide if you would like to learn more about how the SmartScore works.

name: Turn off certificates
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
body:
Since our e-mails are automatically sent, there isn't a way for us to control what time the e-mails are sent. If the e-mails are being sent at an inconvenient time, you can temporarily turn off these e-mails and view the certificates in your account. To turn off the e-mails we send, you can follow these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in to your account.
2) Click the arrow next to your name in the top-right corner to open your account menu, then select Profile & settings.
3) Scroll to the bottom of the window that opens.
4) Clear the Receive weekly summary e-mails checkbox.
5) Click Submit to save your changes.

If you would like, you can access certificates your children have earned by following these steps:

1) Go to http://www.ixl.com/signin and sign in.
2) Click Learning.
3) Click Awards.
4) Click Certificates center.
5) Select the child’s name from the drop-down menu.
6) Click View certificate to see the desired certificate.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know. I will be glad to help.

name: Student Notification

body:
Your book key is usually packaged with your book in a white envelope or printed on the inside of a separate cardboard bi-fold that may be shrink-wrapped in plastic. Quia book keys are 19-character codes that may contain dashes. The fourth character should be "S."

If you purchased a used book or a stand-alone book that did not include the Quia package, you can purchase your book access online. To do so, please log in to your account and enter the course code your instructor gave you. When you see your course information, click on the "buy" link for the book you need. We only sell access to online books through our bookstore, so the price listed is for book access (the same as entering a book key) only. Follow the prompts to enter your credit card information. Your book key will be instantly added to your account and you will be able to open your book to submit your work.

body:
When your instructor creates a course with Quia, he or she automatically receives a course code. Once you enter that course code, you will be registered for your instructor's course. Course codes are unique codes that are made up of a series of 3-6 random letters followed by 3 numbers.

Please contact your instructor for your course code. In instructor accounts, Quia displays the course code below the course title.

body:
You can gain access to your course as a student by following these steps:

1. Go to http://books.quia.com and log in.
2. Click the "Go" button for your course.
3. Click the "Classes" tab.
4. Click the "Submit activities as student" link in the "How do I grade?" box on the right side of the page.
5. A new window with the book in it will open. Close that window.
6. Click the "Student Workstation" link at the top of your main browser window.

You are now enrolled in your own course and can view the book as a student. To do so, go to the "Student Workstation" and click "Open Book".

You can return to the Instructor Workstation at any time by clicking the "Instructor Workstation" link at the top of the page. For the duration of this course, you will be able to switch back and forth between the student and instructor workstations.
greeting: Thank you for contacting Quia.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist you!
name: Submit Activities as a Student

body:
To delete an attempt so that a student can submit an exercise again, please follow these steps:

1. Go to http://books.quia.com and log in.
2. Click on the title of your course.
3. Click on the "Classes" tab.
4. Click on the name of the student whose submission you wish to delete.
5. Use the menus to navigate to the appropriate section of the book.
6. Check the boxes under "Clear score?" next to the exercises you wish to remove submissions for, then click "Clear selected scores."
7. Confirm your choice to clear the scores for those exercises.

Your student will now be able to submit another attempt for that exercise.
greeting: Thank you for contacting Quia.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know.
name: Delete student's attempt

body:
A free, 3-week trial is available for some online books. This trial will allow you full access to your assignments without requiring you to make a purchase.

To begin your free trial, please follow these steps:

1) Go to http://books.quia.com and log in.
2) Enter the course code your instructor gave you, if you have not already done so.
3) Click the "buy" link for the book used in your course.
4) Click the link offering the free 3-week trial, above the information about your online book.
5) Follow the prompts to complete activating your trial.

You will be able to submit your assignments to your instructor. At any time, you may buy or enter a book key to end your trial and add access to your book to your account. If your trial ends, you will not be able to access your assignments until you buy or enter a book key. The work you complete while using your free trial will be permanently saved in your account.
greeting: Thank you for contacting Quia.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know and I will be happy to help.
name: Free trial for book key?

body:
You can follow these steps to add your own files to your announcements board:

1. Go to http://books.quia.com and log in.
2. Click the "Go" button for your course.
3. Go to the "Announcements" tab.
4. Click inside the message text box where you want to insert the file.
5. Type what you want to name the file link. This is the text students click on to download the file, e.g. "Click here for your class syllabus".
6. Highlight the text you just typed.
7. Click the icon that resembles a chain to link your text to your file.
8. Click the small icon to the right of the "Link URL" box.
9. Select the appropriate file from your account and click "OK".
10. Click "Insert".
11. Scroll to the bottom of the screen and click "Save Changes".
greeting: Thank you for contacting Quia.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist you!
name: Adding Files to Announcement Board

body:
It sounds like you are having trouble with the VHL "Supersite," not Quia Books. Supersite is a website created by the publisher Vista Higher Learning. In order to resolve any technical issues with their site you will need to contact Vista Higher Learning support.

Here is the contact information for the VHL Supersite:

http://support.vhlcentral.com

VHL Technical Support: (800)248-2813

If you need to request a refund, contact VHL Customer Service at 800-269-6311.
greeting: Thank you for contacting Quia.
closing: If you have any questions or need assistance with Quia Books, please let me know and I will be happy to help!
name: VHL Supersite

body:
Now that you have successfully completed a Quia course, you can set up a new course with new classes each semester. In most cases, as long as you are using the same book as last semester, you do not need a new book key. In cases where a book key is required, Quia prompts you to enter the key.

To start a new term with new students, follow these steps:

1. Go to http://books.quia.com and log in.
2. Locate the course you want to base the new course on.
3. Do one of the following:
* If you see a "Start new term" link beneath the course title, click on it and skip to Step 6.
* If don't see the "Start new term" link, click the course title (e.g. "Spanish 101").
4. Click the "Options" tab.
5. Click "Create new course".
6. Enter the course information in the appropriate fields.
7. Click "Submit" and your course will be created.
8. Fill out the form to create a class (i.e. section) for students to enroll in.
9. Click "Submit."
10. Click "Create another class" to set up additional sections or click "Done" when all of your classes are set up.
greeting: Thank you for contacting Quia.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist.
name: Start a new term

body:
It appears you have purchased access to the "BOOKTITLE" activities manual. However, your instructor requires you to have access to the complete iLrn package, not just the activities manual. If you believe that your course will not use the online textbook activities, please have your instructor contact us directly to make the necessary changes to your course.

In order to access your assignments as your course is set up, you will need to purchase the $27 upgrade to the iLrn package. This pays for the textbook activities, eBook, and other materials included in the iLrn package but not found in the activities manual.

To upgrade to the iLrn, please follow these steps:

1. Go to http://books.quia.com and log in.
2. Click the "buy" link beneath the name of the book.
3. Follow the prompts to purchase the textbook activities required to upgrade to the iLrn package.

When you're finished, you will instantly have access to the complete iLrn package and you will be able to do your homework.
greeting: Thank you for contacting Quia.
closing: Please let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist you.
name: iLrn upgrade

body:
You can accept late scores from an individual student without changing the due date for the rest of the class by following these steps:

1) Have your student complete any exercises that need to be made up.
2) Go to http://books.quia.com and log in.
3) Click on your course.
4) Click the "Classes" tab.
5) Navigate to the appropriate section using the "Book" and "Section" drop-down lists.
6) Click the "late" link that Quia displays in place of the score for that exercise.
7) Confirm that you want to accept this exercise late from the student.

Quia will accept that score for that student and will count it in their final grade.
greeting: Thank you for contacting Quia.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I'll be happy to help!
name: Accept late scores 1 student

body:
If your teaching assistant does not already have an account on our web site, one can be created by going to http://hlc.quia.com and clicking the "Create account" button.

Once your assistant has provided you with a username, please follow these steps to give your assistant access to your class:

1) Go to http://hlc.quia.com and log in.
2) Click the title of the appropriate course.
3) Click the "Classes" tab.
4) Click the "Class Info" sub-tab.
5) Click the "Edit" link for the appropriate class.
6) Scroll to the bottom of the page and enter your assistant's HLC username in the "Assistant(s)" field.
7) Click "Submit".
greeting: Thank you for contacting our technical support team.
closing: If there's anything else I can help you with, please let me know!
name: Assigning TAs

body:
{!Contact.FirstName},

Thank you for contacting Quia.

Quia provides an accent tool bar for all activities that require you to enter words with accented characters. When you are completing these online exercises, you should see a navigation tool bar at the top of the window that has buttons for "Next Page", "Previous Page", and "Back". If the exercise calls for it, there will also be an accent tool bar beneath the navigation tools.

To use the accent tool bar, place your cursor in the answer field where you want the accented character to appear and click on the character in the tool bar. Quia will enter the accented character where your cursor was positioned.

closing: If you have any questions, please let me know and I will be happy to assist you!

body:
If you are having trouble recording, the first thing you'll want to do is check your Flash settings. To do so, follow these steps:

1. Open a recording exercise and right-click on the white space directly beneath the "Record" button.
2. Select "Settings".
3. At the bottom of the menu, click the second tab from the left (it looks like a monitor with an eye on it).
4. Make sure the "Allow" option and the "Remember" check box are selected.
5. Click the fourth tab (the one with a microphone on it).
6. Make sure the record volume is up all the way and the correct microphone is selected from the drop-down list. (If you have the correct microphone selected, you will see a green and red bar move whenever you speak into your microphone.)
7. Click "Close".

Try recording the exercise again. If you still can't record, then the version of Flash that is installed on your computer may only be compatible with a USB microphone. Newer versions of Flash are designed specifically to work with microphones that connect via USB ports. Using a USB microphone should solve the problem.
greeting: Thank you for contacting our technical support team.
closing: If you have any questions please let me know and I will be happy to assist.
name: Microphone Check

body:
If your results are not showing up in your gradebook, it means that your work was never received by our servers. After you click the "Submit answers" button, you should always receive a feedback page confirming that your answers have been received and providing you with a provisional score. If you see this page, it means your results have been stored and recorded on your results page and in your instructor's account for grading. If you do not see this page, you were not connected to our servers when you submitted your work.

Unfortunately, if our server did not receive your scores, we have no way to retrieve your grades for you.
greeting: Thank you for contacting Quia.
closing: If you have any questions or concerns please let me know.
name: Results not recording

body:
Unfortunately, our privacy policy prevents us from providing any personal information regarding students. However, we will let the student know that the book key has been reported by the bookstore to be stolen, and we will require him or her to fax us proof of purchase. If we do not receive that proof, we will deactivate the book key and any work completed by the student will be erased.

We'll also be happy to supply you with a replacement book key that you can sell in place of the stolen book key.
greeting: Thank you for contacting Quia.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know.
name: Note to bookstore (regarding our policy)

body:
Your book is saved in your account, so you won't need to re-enter a book key. However, you do need to enter a new course code in the field provided to begin submitting activities to your new instructor. Your instructor can provide you with this course code.

If your instructor has trouble locating the course code or you are unable to contact your instructor, feel free to send me your instructor's name, e-mail address, and the title of your new course. I will be happy to try to find it for you.
greeting: Thank you for contacting Quia.
closing: Please let me know if there's anything else I can do to assist you.
name: Key ok -- need course code

body:
I was able to verify your purchase. Here is a replacement book key that you can use to access your online Quia book:

XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX

You can enroll in your Quia course by following these steps:

1. Go to http://books.quia.com
2. Log in to your account. (If you do not already have an account click the "Create an account now" link and enter your information, as prompted.)
3. Enter your book key in the "Enter book key" field and click "Go".
The book will be added to your account. Note that book keys can only be entered once; you can safely discard your key after your book is in your account.
4. Verify that your name is displayed properly. How your name appears here is how it will appear in your instructor's gradebook.
5. Check the box to certify your name and click "Submit".
6. Enter your instructor's course code in the "Enter Course Code" field and click "Go".

You are now enrolled in your instructor's course.

To access your account in the future, go to http://books.quia.com and log in to your account. You will be able to open your book, submit activities, and view your results and any feedback from your instructor.
greeting: Thank you for sending me your book key receipt and information.
closing: Thank you for using Quia! Please let me know if you have any questions.
name: Sending Replacement Book Key

body:
{!Contact.FirstName},

Thank you for contacting Quia.

In order to send you your replacement book key, I will need some additional information.

Please scan or take a digital picture of the receipt from your book purchase and of your book key (with the book key instructions included) and send it to me in a reply to this e-mail.

Please be sure that the receipt and the book keys are clearly legible in your e-mail. Include your name, e-mail address, Quia support ticket ID, and school name to help us process your request as quickly as possible.
greeting: none
closing: Once I receive your information I will be happy to assist you further.
name: Replace Book Key Request

body:
To ensure the best connection between you and your partner, I recommend you both take the following steps:

1) Download and install the Google Chrome browser here:

http://www.google.com/chrome

Chrome is a free, stable browser that you and your partner can both use to log in to your accounts and open your recording exercises. Using the Chrome browser will solve a number of different recording issues that can be caused by your current browser.

2) Connect to your partner using the "Voiceboard" or "find an e-partner" link after opening your book. Partnering up from here will allow you and your partner to connect before opening the exercise you plan on completing, and should establish a stronger connection.
greeting: Thank you for contacting our technical support team.
closing: If you are still having trouble connecting, please give me a call at (877)282-4400x4 and I will be happy to walk through the steps with you to test the connection.
name: Partner Recordings

body:
It looks like you've already linked your book with your course in your account. I was able to open the book from your account and access the assignments. Please go to http://books.quia.com and log in to your account, then try to click the "Open Book" button to open a new window and access the book.

If a new window does not open, you may have a pop-up blocker installed that is preventing the window from opening. Here you can find instructions for disabling pop-up blockers on commonly used web browsers:

http://www.wikihow.com/Disable-Popup-Blockers

If you have disabled your pop-up blocker, or if you don't have one installed, and you are still unable to open your book, please send me the exact steps you are taking to access your work. Also, if you are receiving an error message, please tell me exactly what it says. This information will help me to diagnose the problem and better assist you.
greeting: Thank you for contacting Quia.
closing: Let me know if there's anything else I can do to help!
name: Disable Popup Blocker

body:
You can gain access to your course as a student by following these steps:

1) Go to http://hlc.quia.com and log in.
2) Click the title of your course.
3) Click the "Classes" tab.
4) Click the "Submit activities as student" link in the "How do I grade?" box on the right side of the page.
5) A new window with the book in it will open. Close that window.
6) Click the "Student Workstation" link at the top of your main browser window.

A new window will open to show you your Student Workstation. You are now enrolled in your own course and can view the book as a student.

You can return to the Instructor Workstation at any time by going back to the other window. For the duration of this course, you will be able to switch back and forth between the student and instructor workstations.
greeting: Thank you for contacting our technical support team.
closing: Let me know if you have any questions and I will be happy to assist you!
name: Submit Activities as a Student

body:
{!Contact.FirstName},

Thank you for contacting our technical support team.

Unfortunately, we cannot extend your online access for free. You will need to purchase new access to your online book in order to continue using it. Many titles can be bought through our online bookstore at a lower price by purchasing access for only 6 months. If we do not sell keys with shorter access through our online bookstore, your campus bookstore may sell 6-month keys at a lower price.

If you are unable to purchase an extension, I recommend that you have your instructor contact your school's publisher's sales representative on your behalf. Although I cannot guarantee that the extension will be approved, your sales representative may authorize us to issue you a new key.

You can follow these steps to export your students' results to a CSV file:

1. Go to http://ilrn.heinle.com and click the "Sign In" button in the top-right corner.
2. Enter your username and password in the spaces provided and click "Log in."
3. Click the title of your course
4. Go to the "Options" tab.
5. Click "Export results".
6. Select the section you want to export. To select more than one section, press and hold the "CTRL" key as you click on each section with your mouse.
7. Click "Export".
8. Make a selection at the prompt to either open the file or save it to your computer for future use.

body:
There is an issue with Flash player that can occur on some Macs which can prevent you from being able to update your Flash settings. Without updated Flash settings, you will not be able to make recordings on our site. To work around this issue and update your settings, please follow these steps:

1) Click on the Apple icon in the upper left corner of your screen.
2) Click on "System Preferences".
3) In the "Other" section, click on "Flash Player".
4) Click on "Camera and Mic", and then click "Camera and Microphone Settings by Site".
5) In the new window that opens, click on the "+" sign in the lower left corner.
6) Enter "quia.com" (without quotes) as the website domain.
7) Select "Allow" from the drop-down box, then click the "Add" button.

This will allow our site to use your microphone during your recording exercises. You should now be able to complete your assignments.
greeting: Thank you for contacting Quia.
closing: If you have any questions, please let me know.
name: Mac cannot change flash settings

body:
You can view assignments from either the calendar or assignment list. Assignments that have due dates will show up on your calendar. Your calendar may open automatically when you click the picture of your book in your account. If not, click the "Calendar" link at the top of the page or under the "My Tools" tab after opening your book. On the calendar, you will see a list of all exercises due in the upcoming weeks. Click on an exercise title to open and complete it.

If you do not have a calendar available (because your instructor has set no due dates), you can click on the "Assignments" or "View by chapter" link to view your exercises. If your course uses more than one book, you will need to use the appropriate menus to navigate between books and chapters.
greeting: Thank you for contacting Quia.
closing: Let me know if there's anything else I can do to help!
name: How do I view assignments?

body:
If you are having trouble recording, the first thing you'll want to do is check your Flash settings. To do so, please follow these steps:

1. Open a recording exercise and right-click on the white space directly beneath the "Record" button.
2. Select "Settings".
3. At the bottom of the menu, click the second tab from the left (it looks like a monitor with an eye on it).
4. Make sure the "Allow" option and the "Remember" check box are selected.
5. Click the fourth tab (the one with a microphone on it).
6. Make sure the record volume is up all the way and the correct microphone is selected from the drop-down list. (If you have the correct microphone selected, you will see a green and red bar move whenever you speak into your microphone.)
7. Click "Close".

Please note that if you are using Google Chrome as your browser, it will also prompt you to give it permission to access your microphone, in addition to the settings above. After clicking the "Record" button, look for a notification at the top of the window and click "Allow" when prompted. If you do not see a notification, our site may have been blocked previously. In that case, you may see an icon of a video camera with a red X through it. Click on this icon, then click "Allow", and "Reload" when prompted. You should then be able to complete your recording successfully.

If you still can't record, then the version of Flash that is installed on your computer may only be compatible with a USB microphone. Newer versions of Flash are designed specifically to work with microphones that connect via USB ports. Using a USB microphone should solve the problem.
greeting: Thank you for contacting our technical support team.
closing: If you have any questions please let me know and I will be happy to assist.
name: Microphone Check (Chrome)

body:
There is an issue with Flash player that can occur on some Macs which can prevent you from being able to update your Flash settings. Without updated Flash settings, you will not be able to make recordings on our site. To work around this issue and update your settings, please follow these steps:

1) Click on the Apple icon in the upper left corner of your screen.
2) Click on "System Preferences".
3) In the "Other" section, click on "Flash Player".
4) Click on "Camera and Mic", and then click "Camera and Microphone Settings by Site".
5) In the new window that opens, click on the "+" sign in the lower left corner.
6) Enter "quia.com" (without quotes) as the website domain.
7) Select "Allow" from the drop-down box, then click the "Add" button.
greeting: Thank you for contacting our technical support team.
closing: This will allow our site to use your microphone during your recording exercises. You should now be able to complete your assignments.

When you answer the same problem multiple times, each score is recorded separately. By default, only the score used to calculate your grade in your results is displayed. Exercises with more than one attempt will have a small triangle next to them, which you can click to expand and view results for all of your attempts. A number is displayed in brackets next to each exercise to indicate which attempt it is, but only the attempt being used to calculate your final grade will remain at the top of the expanded list.

To learn more about viewing your results, or to see an example of this in action, please view our helpful informational sheet here:

http://www.quia.com/files/quia/users/quiasupport/HLC/viewingResults_HLC.pdf

Your class will be deleted. Any students who were enrolled in that class will be dropped and their results will be lost.

body:
To change the exercises that are assigned in your course, please follow these steps:

1. Go to http://hlc.quia.com and log in.
2. Click on the title of your course.
3. Click on the "Books" tab.
4. Click the "Assign" option beneath the "Books" tab.
5. Use the menus to navigate to the appropriate chapter and section.
6. Click on the "A" icon associated with each exercise to assign or unassign it. Unassigned exercises will have a red circle and slash through the "A" icon and won't be calculated toward students' total scores.

Please note that the exercises listed here with a red dot contain questions that will require you to grade them before students' scores are final. Exercises listed here with a green dot will be graded automatically.

If you wish to set a due date for an exercise, click on the icon of a calendar for that exercise and select the date from the calendar that appears. To assign the same due date to several exercises at once, please follow these steps:

7. Check the box to the left of each exercise that shares a due date.
8. Open the "Actions" menu at the top of the list of exercises and choose "Set due date."
9. Select a due date from the calendar that appears.

You will see the due date listed in the column on the right for all of the exercises you selected.

We have a helpful info sheet for assigning activities with screen shots of each of the steps in this process. I recommend taking a look at it for more information:

http://www.quia.com/files/quia/users/quiasupport/HLC/assigningActivities_HLC.pdf
greeting: Thank you for contacting our technical support team.

To begin your free trial, please follow these steps:

2) Enter the course code your instructor gave you, if you have not already done so.
3) Click the link offering the free 3-week trial, beneath the information about your online book.

You will be able to submit your assignments to your instructor. At any time, you may buy or enter a book key to end your trial and add access to your book to your account. If your trial ends, you will not be able to access your assignments until you enter a book key. The work you complete while using your free trial will be permanently saved in your account.

You can accept late scores from an individual student without changing the due date for the rest of the class by following these steps:

1) Have your student complete any exercises that need to be made up.
2) Go to http://hlc.quia.com and log in.
3) Click on the title of your course.
4) Click the "Classes" tab.
5) Navigate to the appropriate section using the "Book" and "Section" drop-down lists.
6) Click the "late" link that the Heinle Learning Center displays in place of the score for that exercise.
7) Confirm that you want to accept this exercise late from the student.

The Heinle Learning Center will accept that score for that student and will count it in their final grade.

body:
Now that you have successfully completed an online course, you can set up a new course with new classes each semester.

To start a new term with new students, please follow these steps:

1) Go to http://hlc.quia.com and log in.
2) Locate the course you want to base the new course on.
3) Do one of the following:
* If you see a "Start new term" link beneath the course title, click on it and skip to Step 7.
* If don't see the "Start new term" link, click the course title (e.g. "Spanish 101").
4) Click the "Options" tab.
5) Click "Create new course".
6) Enter the course information in the appropriate fields.
7) Click "Submit" and your course will be created.
8) Fill out the form to create a class (i.e. section) for students to enroll in.
9) Click "Submit."
10) Click "Create another class" to set up additional sections or click "Done" when all of your classes are set up.

body:
Thank you for contacting us about clearing your students' accounts. I understand that your teachers want students to work on skills they’ve practiced before, and that it can be confusing for students if they see scores from their prior work.

However, we strongly advise against clearing student data. Doing so would erase essential parts of IXL’s personalized learning experience, including:
  • All of your students’ hard-earned awards, certificates, ribbons and medals.
  • Your students’ personalized skill recommendations and action plans.
  • All progress monitoring data in IXL Analytics. This would prevent both you and your teachers from tracking any student achievement or growth over time.
In addition, we have found that parents and students become upset when they learn that their hard work and progress in IXL has “disappeared.”
greeting: none
closing: I would be happy to provide some suggestions that may help you when students are revisiting IXL skills. If it's more convenient to discuss these options over the phone, please feel free to give me a call.

body:
Thank you for contacting us about clearing your students' accounts. I understand that you want students to work on skills they’ve practiced before and that it can be confusing for students if they see scores from their prior work.

However, we strongly advise against clearing student data. Doing so would erase essential parts of IXL’s personalized learning experience, including:
  • All of your students’ hard-earned awards, certificates, ribbons and medals.
  • Your students’ personalized skill recommendations and action plans.
  • All progress monitoring data in IXL Analytics. This would prevent you from tracking any student achievement or growth over time.
In addition, we have found that parents and students become upset when they learn that their hard work and progress in IXL has “disappeared.”

name: Teacher clearing student data (bulk)

body:
In place of traditional assessment and placement tests, we have developed a unique IXL Diagnostic. The IXL Diagnostic is designed to give you a snapshot of each of your students’ working grade levels. It also groups students working at similar levels and can show the most common skill recommendations for each of the student groups, allowing you to plan for small-group instruction. It tells you exactly what students know and what to do next to to help them improve.

In order to get started with the IXL Diagnostic, students can begin by signing in to their accounts and clicking Diagnostic at the top of the page. We recommend that students initially aim to diagnose until they reveal complete Diagnostic data. For most students this will be about 60-90 questions, which don’t have to be done in one sitting. The amount of questions needed to diagnose will also vary based on each student’s performance and existing practice results, as previous student practice will be taken into account. Once the student has finished the Diagnostic, we recommend students answer about 5-10 diagnostic questions per week to keep the Diagnostic up to date.

The Diagnostic level indicates a student’s working grade level. For example, a level of 500 indicates readiness to work on fifth-grade level skills. All student levels start as a range while the Diagnostic continues to narrow down that data as the student diagnoses. When the Diagnostic has enough information to pinpoint the student's level, it will appear as a single number.
greeting: Thank you for reaching out to us.
closing: Please let me know if you have any other questions. I'm always happy to help.
name: Placement Tests/IXL Diagnostic

body:
IXL is a fully web-based program, and as a result, we don't provide any worksheets, or downloadable or printable material. This also includes our app, which requires an internet connection to access.

Instead of requiring you to grade and manage worksheets, IXL tracks every child’s practice so that you can freely monitor their progress with our comprehensive reports. In addition, as children practice, IXL adapts questions to their ability, increasing the level of difficulty as they improve and providing instant feedback and explanations when children answer questions incorrectly.
